items: üíª Opened [PR #139](https://github.com/animint/animint2/pull/139) to introduce three new layout-related attributes in `theme_animint`: `rowspan`, `colspan`, and `last_in_row`, enabling more flexible multi-plot grid layouts.
`rowspan=2`: allows a plot to occupy two rows (default = 1).
`colspan=2`: allows a plot to span across two columns (default = 1).
`last_in_row=TRUE`: ensures the plot ends the current HTML table row (default = FALSE), useful for proper row closures in rendered layouts.

üõ†Ô∏è Raised [PR #204](https://github.com/animint/animint2/pull/204) to address a critical issue where `geom_raster()` could silently fail and disrupt plot rendering. This fix improves robustness and developer feedback through better error reporting.
Explored how `theme_animint()` leverages HTML table structure to control visual layout across plots.
Began implementing the underlying rendering logic to handle complex combinations of rowspan and colspan.
Identified the root cause of the `geom_raster` failure and implemented a clean error-handling mechanism to prevent crashes.

learnings.content: Learned how declarative layout logic in R themes can influence HTML-based visualization rendering. Also gained insight into debugging silent failures in layered plotting systems like animint2.
